document.title: Fine Arts Standards of Learning Music Elementary

E67FF9CB20444458AFE66D4384EF5A50.description:
Create movement to
illustrate rondo (ABACA)
musical form.

8E5D1A489D124FD0B85572E339E43879.description:
Perform dances and other
music activities.

AA18799651B549268E892B138E5053E2.description:
The student will respond to
music with movement.

457428C238DC4E76B1807DDD85EC5A45.description:
Perform and illustrate sets
of beats grouped in twos
and threes.

33B202273A0B47C4B5F141B066525B87.description:
Include dotted quarter
note followed by an
eighth note.

6563355E87864DF89B478419B24F664B.description:
Use instruments, body
percussion, and voice.

0018E386D7AE414ABEA87FA41CCE72A8.description:
Include patterns that
suggest duple and triple
meter.

A5642782C7B74C65BABDB2796514FD9E.description:
The student will classify,
perform, and count rhythmic
patterns.

02F53459AD40409483404BAE46BB1F64.description:
Accompany songs and
chants with tonic,
subdominant, and
dominant chords.

3F790772066D4C14B7AD8817ADCF442D.description:
Play with expression using
dynamics and phrasing.

66AD2EBD0C484630A880721123782BBE.description:
Play a given melody on an
instrument.

E673C2C657B04E70B0C1D71364C956ED.description:
Play melodies of
increasing difficulty
notated in varying forms.

EC1B5D55E9A8446597B5BDE0C47BDFD7.description:
Play music of increasing
difficulty in two-part
ensembles

3E7DE137AEB14085934843096AD829AE.description:
The student will develop skills
for individual and ensemble
instrumental performance.

D3730FAA52CE4D5D945C6867A0BACCF8.description:
Sing with expression using
dynamics and phrasing.

555E6DF0DA824121889B3D2A4A15220B.description:
Sing melodies notated in
varying forms.

AB5F3D283738472FB49D36A2875C18E3.description:
Sing with a clear tone
quality and correct
intonation.

8F39FA3F28014CF3839B0B83945A9C95.description:
The student will develop skills
for individual and ensemble
singing performance.

FADCCBD6CF6142128DB1C1D2A36239AE.description:
Identify dynamic markings
(e.g., p, mp, mf, f).

83EFC6674E0E4F63AD8DEF97B04E7CCF.description:
Identify the meaning of
the upper and lower
numbers of simple time
signatures (
2
4,
3
4,
4
4).

9919CE03C8AC4D59980ADE8B84759DA3.description:
Use a system to sight-read
melodic and rhythmic
patterns.

4EBA25A885CA4BDB9EA00F803B6D2EE1.description:
Read and notate rhythmic
patterns that include
dotted quarter note
followed by an eighth
note.

D0DCED97402C4095B7495F044A02FD83.description:
Use traditional notation to
write melodies containing
stepwise motion.

96F6E6FE12564FB087D5BE90BC4BEAB5.description:
Read melodies based on a
hexatonic scale.

60635D3612094C4CB296E5426AA6D8DF.description:
The student will demonstrate
music literacy.

1DDDD16828B24C20B83BABDF0712FFA0.description:
Music Literacy: Acquire the technical skills
and artistic knowledge
necessary for creative,
expressive, and artistic
performance.
Demonstrate understanding
of elements of music and ways
they are used for artistic
performance and creative
expression

D2988A6A1E754B1799E253DD629CEA79.description:
The student will explore
connections between music
and other fields of knowledge
for the development of
problem-solving skills.

D1995B09AC5E4DCE983560E8A209ACBC.description:
Cultivate connections to other
fine arts and fields of
knowledge. Identify and cultivate
connections between music
and other fields of knowledge
to develop problem-solving
skills.

D19FDAAE5902460786716E0D5D573195.description:
The student will compare and
contrast digital and traditional
methods for creating music.

66E6679AB352486A9E4390063683992F.description:
Understand and explore the
impact of current and
emerging technologies. Participate in a rapidly changing
world of music and explore the
impact of current and emerging
technologies, media, and
processes.

1B66F756149349E599A5DB78B1413035.description:
The student will identify skills
learned in music class that relate
to a variety of career options.

8475F4FD14D8453A94E067B98D99AF73.description:
College, career, and the 21st
Century Workplace. Connect music content and
skills to career options, college
opportunities, and the 21st
Century workplace.

C43F9DB82854411E9F1328CA5F664080.description:
The student will describe digital
citizenship for exploring music
topics.

91134F1AA98D44328B393E741CC75ED0.description:
Ethical and legal
considerations for music and
intellectual property. Identify and understand ethical
and legal considerations for
engaging with music, resources,
and source material as a
responsible citizen.

05C11337D88545B5B03AC51B51DDB87A.description:
The student will explain how
music is an integral part of one’s
life and community.

401427CC3C5648FB9EA67F14C160A170.description:
Understand music as a form of
community engagement. Identify and interact with music
and develop a lifelong
engagement as a performer,
supporter, advocate, and
audience member.

5A03CF2415C2422E827D5998359A5A85.description:
Explain how criteria used to
value music may vary
between people and
communities.

0DF84FD61DAA4A4FAB7837824C064453.description:
Examine how music from
popular culture reflects the
past and influences the
present.

B88C20AD37054CD7B0A0FBB51ED1BDC0.description:
Listen to and describe
music from a variety of
world cultures.

09581E6A404240178132973FCB4FB454.description:
Describe musical styles from
a variety of time periods
and places.

7FC82007F0C94D0E8D17B48372F19FAD.description:
Describe music
compositions from different
periods of music history.

20B48545A0AE4C789DF73B1C3B500200.description:
The student will explore
historical and cultural aspects of
music.

E00AC3C70C8B45B18F0F1D42B3167624.description:
Understand cultural and
historical influences of music. Demonstrate understanding of
cultural and historical influences
of music.

4E829047DDE343D9BA6A1D13107F9C54.description:
Give and receive age-appropriate feedback on
performance.

76C7C444B0294A0987695382B2C726F2.description:
Explain active listening
for musical
understanding.

1D897E52B3DD4EB8B7A8ED5E7A551D78.description:
Demonstrate audience
and participant etiquette
appropriate for the
purposes and settings in
which music is
performed.

1FB1DCF7D10E4674BF7E9C19C392BD4E.description:
The student will apply
collaboration and
communication skills for
music rehearsal and
performance.

0FB36C5D067C4059BD0A7CE2C97901B4.description:
Develop collaboration and
communication skills for music
rehearsal and performance. Identify and apply collaboration and
communication skills for rehearsal
and performance of music.

D7BC8C60EB5F41598FDFD41C76E7F44A.description:
The student will explain
personal preferences for
musical works and
performances using music
terminology.

AF7A4B84976942D7956A74DB47EB051C.description:
Formulate and justify personal
responses and connections to music. Recognize, justify, and articulate
personal responses, beliefs, and
opinions regarding music and
recognize the value in learning about
diverse opinions and responses to
music.

9B718398EE6B4CBBB5B0FCC75881C3CF.description:
Describe performances
and offer constructive
feedback.

9BBE1DC80A804E0DABF9E28FFB1D1602.description:
Review criteria used to
evaluate compositions
and performances.

A2390C3C28364BEEA3DDD9CDECB8950F.description:
Identify elements of
music through listening
using music terminology.

C59EB7B1378C4FB682C2D84F5C4D2027.description:
Listen to, compare, and
contrast music
compositions from a
variety of cultures and
time periods.

FCFB9E394D094F1DBC4EE34BBB3DB882.description:
Distinguish between
major and minor tonality.

CE3A06B00FC5465C954ECD96C4ACDA32.description:
Identify instruments from
a variety of music
ensembles both visually
and aurally.

05CDFCA1FDC64A409C61F0C480C9EA2A.description:
The student will analyze and
evaluate music.

DD4074C954D044E6A41075A149AFB37D.description:
Analyze, interpret, and evaluate
music. Develop critical thinking skills in the
analysis, interpretation, and
evaluation of the work of self and
others.

75BB95BE6901434388446A8543699069.description:
Reflect on the process and
outcome of creating music
and revise work based on
peer and teacher feedback.

9D93C668857B4DF5BAACF203313B79A6.description:
Describe elements of a
creative process for music.

4AE77CEC823C4C7E96B94EAA04F195C5.description:
Describe ideas for creating
music as a group.

97F39F431CB04566A9C7200E83F065D0.description:
The student will apply a
creative process for music.

5050BD0A4ABE4A2B8606BC21D67145BF.description:
Understand and apply a creative
process to develop ideas for creating
and performing music.
Understand and apply a creative process
to guide the development of ideas and
original work.

01D57D33C57F41519B3FB1725D8CD865.description:
Compose short melodic
and rhythmic phrases
within specified guidelines.

BF6FBB92060140E29A5879CF2EEFA6FC.description:
Improvise melodies and
rhythms using a variety of
sound sources.

8F6ECFD040114EB4B512E0F83FC02AFF.description:
The student will improvise and
compose music.

3800071713624202BA789A2A4147DF34.description:
Apply creative thinking to composing
and improvising music. Apply creative thinking by employing
originality, flexibility, experimentation,
individual voice, and imagination to
improvise and compose music.
